data.content:
noun
plural ~ marks
[count] :one of a pair of punctuation marks or that are used to show the beginning and the end of a quotation, to show that something is a title, to show that a word or phrase is being used in a special way, etc. - usually plural
There were quotations marks around the phrase. = The phrase was in quotation marks.
Titles of newspaper articles should be placed/put in quotation marks. - called also (Brit) inverted comma
